CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 31, 1956, pg. 1, reads: "Thousands Observe 'Prayer Day' Here! - 'Let My People Go' - Members of Wesley Center AME Zion Church and people from the community gathered at noon on 'Prayer Day,' March 28, to offer special prayers for the Rev. Marin Luther Kin and the other heroic bus boycotters in Montgomery, Ala. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of men and women bowing heads in prayer, including Madeline Sharpe Foggie wearing dark beret on left in rear, Morris Fountain Sr. near center in back row, Shadrack Moon on right in background, and Rev. Charles H. Foggie on left in foreground, in Wesley Center AME Zion Church for Prayer Day honoring Montgomery Alabama bus boycotters

(Charles Herbert), 1912-2000.
